TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Settings extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The Settings provider contains global system-level device preferences.

remarks.para: The Settings provider contains global system-level device preferences.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Activity Action: Show settings for accessibility modules.

remarks.para: Activity Action: Show settings for accessibility modules.
In some cases, a matching Activity may not exist, so ensure you safeguard against this.
Input: Nothing.
Output: Nothing.

Docs.summary: Activity Action: Show add account screen for creating a new account.

remarks.para: Activity Action: Show add account screen for creating a new account.
In some cases, a matching Activity may not exist, so ensure you safeguard against this.

The account types available to add may be restricted by adding an extra to the Intent with one or more syncable content provider's authorities. Only account types which can sync with that content provider will be offered to the user.
Account types can also be filtered by adding an extra to the Intent with one or more account types.
Input: Nothing.
Output: Nothing.

Docs.summary: Activity Action: Show screen of details about a particular application.

remarks.para: Activity Action: Show screen of details about a particular application.

Input: The Intent's data URI specifies the application package name to be shown, with the "package" scheme. That is "package:com.my.app".
Output: Nothing.

Docs.summary: Activity Action: Show settings to enable/disable input method subtypes.

remarks.para: Activity Action: Show settings to enable/disable input method subtypes.
In some cases, a matching Activity may not exist, so ensure you safeguard against this.

To tell which input method's subtypes are displayed in the settings, add extra to this Intent with the input method id. If there is no extra in this Intent, subtypes from all installed input methods will be displayed in the settings.

Docs.summary: Activity Extra: Limit available options in launched activity based on the given account types.

remarks.para: Activity Extra: Limit available options in launched activity based on the given account types.
This can be passed as an extra field in an Activity Intent with one or more account types as a String[]. This field is used by some intents to alter the behavior of the called activity.
Example: The intent restricts the account types to the specified list.

Docs.summary: Activity Extra: Limit available options in launched activity based on the given authority.

remarks.para: Activity Extra: Limit available options in launched activity based on the given authority.

This can be passed as an extra field in an Activity Intent with one or more syncable content provider's authorities as a String[]. This field is used by some intents to alter the behavior of the called activity.
Example: The intent restricts the account types available based on the authority given.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
